edu.kit.informatik.matchthree.framework.interfaces

Interface Matcher


  • public interface Matcher
    A method of finding matches on a board starting with an initial (set of) position(s).
    Author:
    IPD Koziolek

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Position>> match(Board board, Position initial)
      Returns all matches found on the board starting from the given initial position.
      java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Position>> matchAll(Board board, java.util.Set<Position> initial)
      Returns all matches found on the board starting from the given set of initial position.

    • Method Detail

      • match

        java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Position>> match(Board board,
                                             Position initial)
        Returns all matches found on the board starting from the given initial position.
        Parameters:
        board - the board to match on
        initial - the position to start matching from. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        all matches found
        Throws:
        BoardDimensionException - if the initial position is not contained in the board

      • matchAll

        java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Position>> matchAll(Board board,
                                                java.util.Set<Position> initial)
        Returns all matches found on the board starting from the given set of initial position.

        If one of the given positions is not contained in the board, a BoardDimensionException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        board - the board to match on
        initial - the positions to start matching from. Must not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        all matches found
        Throws:
        BoardDimensionException - if one of the initial positions is not contained in the board
        See Also:
        match(Board, Position)
